{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3551516,"name":"Ryan zheng","username":"Rzheng1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rzheng1232/{size}/182897_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T23:54:33.054Z","cooked":"

Hey guys,
I have a problem with out swerve drive, while it drives and functions completely fine, however recently while trying to program April tag alignment, I just realized the left and right directions and the yaw on the odometry are inverted. I tried using the YAGSL 8 steps The eight steps | YAGSL to help me debug this issue, but every time the left/right odometry was fixed, the forward/backwards odometry became inverted. I looked on other forum posts but so far their solutions haven’t worked for me. Our code is linked here: CrescendoCodeMigrated2025/CrescendoCodeUpdatedImported2025/src/main/java/frc/robot at main · DesteoyerRZSS/CrescendoCodeMigrated2025 · GitHub
Any help would be greatly appreciated, thank you!

Classic NavX MXP is connecting and disconnecting suddenly Electrical
I dug into this issue this morning and it boils down to this. “YAGSL poses are blue-origin. The SwerveDrive.zeroGyro function resets the gyro offset to the current reading and rsets the odometry to the current pose with the heading as 0 (facing to the red alliance). On startup SmartDashboard/swerve/imu/adjusted should be relative to this. So if you are on the red alliance facing the blue alliance your gyro reading should be 180deg. The odometry heading is impacted by the module reporting. So if…

In addition to this context you should really decide whether or not you should multiply your controller input by negative 1

Hey!
Thanks for your reply. I have tried multiplying my controller inputs by negative one, but it doesn’t work. I’m mainly focusing on syncing the robot’s odometry with the robot’s movements since when the robot is moving in the negative y direction, the odometry thinks the robot is moving in the positive y direction. As a result, the odometry behaves very weirdly when using it with April tag position estimates. I have tried ensuring the cancoders are CCW positive and also tried different combinations of inverting the gyro and drive encoders to no avail.
